SoccerAPI
  • API
  • View page source

API

What follows is a table of the important terms used in this document.

Key

Meaning

Variabiles

Class instance attributes set in the method

Parameters

Parameters passed to methods

The main SoccerAPI module is used for data retrieval, while by using the classes in the Obj it is possible to query the data.

Main module

class soccerapi.soccerapi.SoccerAPI(config: dict = {})

The main object.

Variables:

  • db – PostgreSQL database initalization.

  • visualize – initialize a player data object.

  • app – app data configuration.

Vartype:

PostgreSQL

Example:

Import the soccerapi.soccerapi module, then:

>>> config = {"fapi_host" : "api-football-v1.p.rapidapi.com", "fapi_key" : "API-FOOTBALL API KEY"}
>>> api = soccerapi.soccerapi.SoccerAPI(config)
>>> haaland = api.db.get("players", "82172")
>>> stat = haaland.statistic("shots")

Create a new instance.

Parameters:

config (dict) –

This object has a few values and defaults:

  • debug (int): if set to 1 print errors out to the console. If set to 0 it will not. Defaults to 0.

  • fapi_host (str): the hostname used to make requests to API-Football.

  • fapi_key (str): API-Football API Key used for authentication.

  • rate_limit_call_interval (int): rate limit interval in seconds.

    Purpose

    Help avoiding rate limiting FBRef puts in place that prevents data scraping. Too many requests to FBRef can trigger a 24 hour IP Block.

    Recommended value

    60

  • rate_limit_max_calls (int): number of rate limited calls Soccer API can make over the time set by rate_limit_call_interval.

    Purpose

    Helps avoid rate limiting FBRef puts in place that prevents data scraping.

    Recommended value

    5

Example:

config = {
    'debug': 1,
    'fapi_host': 'api-football-v1.p.rapidapi.com',
    'fapi_key': 'API KEY',
    'rate_limit_call_interval': 60,
    'rate_limit_max_calls': 5,
}

export_csv(objects, filename='soccer_api_objects.csv')

Export objects to a CSV file.

Parameters:

  • objects (list[Any]) – a list of objects.

  • filename (str) – the output file name. Defaults to soccer_api_objects.csv.

import_csv(path) → list

Import data from a CSV file into an object.

Parameters:

path (str) – the input file name.

Returns:

a list of objects.

Return type:

list[Any]

import_object(path: str) → Any

Import a JSON object.

Parameters:

path (str) – the name of the JSON file.

Returns:

an object from the database.

Return type:

Any

Lib

class soccerapi.lib.postgres.PostgreSQL(app: dict)

The main database object.

Variables:

  • app (dict) – app data configuration. This value is usually passed from the main SoccerAPI object.

  • schema – a class containing data in the form of dictionaries

  • has_connection (int) – tells if database connection is possible. If one or more of the connection parameters are missing this value is set to 0, otherwise it is set to 1.

  • connection_params – PostgreSQL connection settings.

  • cache – cache data.

Create a new instance.

Parameters:

app (dict) – see previous description.

search(table_name: str, query: dict) → list[Any]

Find and return objects.

Parameters:

  • table_name (str) – database table to search on. possible values are players, teams or leagues.

  • query (dict[str]) –

    key-value pair for the ID type to be searched.

    Examples:

    >>> api.db.search(table_name=players, {'player_id': '12345'})
>>> api.db.search(table_name=players, {'player_fapi_id': '12345'})
>>> api.db.search(table_name=players, {'player_tm_id': '12345'})
>>> api.db.search(table_name=players, {'player_fbref_id' : '12345'})

Returns:

a list of objects that the search yields.

Return type:

list[Any]

Obj

class soccerapi.obj.player.Player(player_data: dict, db)

The soccer Player object.

Variables:

  • table – the object type. This value cannot be changed and is fixed to player.

  • first_name (str) – player’s first name.

  • last_name (str) – player’s last name.

  • id (str) – player’s Soccer API ID.

  • tm_id (str) – player’s Transfermarkt ID.

  • fpai_id (str) – player’s API-Football ID.

  • understat_id (str) – player’s Understat ID.

  • db (Any) – a database instance.

Create a new instance.

Parameters:

  • player_data (dict) – an object containing the player’s data as strings

  • db (Any) – a database instance.

analyze_shots(shots) → dict[Statistic]

Get the analysis of a Player object Understat shooting data.

Returns:

a dictionary of Statistic Objects. In case of an error

Return type:

dict[Statistic]

country() → str

Get the country the Player object is from.

Variables:

player_country – a country code.

Returns:

a country code.

Return type:

str

current_team() → Team

Get the current team of the Player object.

Variables:

team – the player’s team.

Returns:

the team.

Return type:

Team

export()

Export the Player object as a JSON file.

Note

The output filename is in the format player_{self.id}.json.

fbref_image() → str

Get a URL of the Player object FBRef image.

Returns:

a URL

Return type:

str

image() → str

Get a URL to the Player object API-Football image.

Returns:

a URL

Return type:

str

import_data(data: dict[str])

Populate Player object data based on a Player JSON file.

Parameters:

data (dict[str]) – JSON representation of the Player object.

Variables:

  • fapi_profile

  • player_country

  • team

  • stats_cache

market_value(year: str | None = None) → int

Get the Player’s Transfermarkt Market Value for a given year.

Parameters:

year (Optional[str]) – the year to be selected. If this parameter is not set, get the current value.

Return type:

int

name() → str

Get the name of the Player.

Returns:

the first and last names.

Return type:

str

positions() → list[str]

Get a list of positions the player is known to play.

Returns:

A list of positions in the form of two letter abbreviations.

Return type:

list[str]

profile()

Return the API-Football profile of the Player object.

Variables:

fapi_profile

Returns:

the FAPI profile.

Return type:

Any

scouting_data() → dict[Statistic] | int

Get the Player object FBRef scouting profile.

Returns:

an dictionary of of Statistic objects or 0 in case of an error.

Return type:

dict[Statistic] | int

shots_over_season() → list

Get the raw Player object Understat shooting data over a season.

Returns:

a list of data, or an empty list in case of error.

Return type:

list

statistic(stat, year: str | None = None) → str | int

Get the Player object FBRef statistics for a given year and statistic.

Parameters:

  • stat (str) – internal or display name of a statistic.

  • year (Optional[str]) – desired year for the statistics. See the statistic method for more information.

Returns:

a statistic object or 0

Return type:

str | int

statistics(year=None) → Statistic

Returns the Player object FBRef Statistics for a given year.

Parameters:

year (Optional[str]) – desired year for the statistics. If not set get the previous year if the current month is between January and June, or the current year otherwise.

Returns:

a hash of Statistic objects

Return type:

Statistic

to_json() → dict

Get a JSON representation of the Player object.

Return type:

dict

class soccerapi.obj.team.Team(team_data, db)

The Team object.

Variables:

  • id (str) – Team’s Soccer API ID.

  • fbref_id (str) – Teams’s FBRef ID.

  • fbref_stat_detail_level (str) – level of Statistic detail FBRef provides for this league.

  • tm_id (str) – Team’s Transfermarkt ID.

  • fpai_id (str) – Team’s API-Football ID

  • db (PostgreSQL) – PostgreSQL database initalization object.

Create a new instance.

Parameters:

  • team_data

  • db (PostgreSQL) – PostgreSQL database initalization object.

country() → str

Get the country the Team object is from.

Returns:

a country code.

Return type:

str

export()

Export the Team object as a JSON file.

Note

The output filename is in the format team_{self.id}.json.

fixture(date: str = None) → Fixture | None

Get a Team object Fixture for a given date.

Parameters:

date (str) – the date to be selected.

Returns:

a Fixture object, or None in case of error.

Return type:

Fixture | None

Important

In contrast to the fixtures method, the date parameter is required here!

fixtures(year: str | None = None) → list[Fixture] | list

Get a list of Team objects Fixtures for a given year.

Parameters:

year (Optional[str]) – the year to be selected. If this parameter is not set, get the current value.

Returns:

a list of Fixture, or an empty list in case of error.

Return type:

list[Fixture] | list

Important

Gets info from the previous year if the current month is between January and June, or the current year otherwise.

import_data(data: dict[str])

Populate Team object data based on a Team JSON file.

Parameters:

data (dict[str]) – JSON representation of the Team object.

Variables:

  • fapi_profile

  • stats_cache

  • opps_stats_cache

leagues() → list

Returns the Leagues a team is competing in currently.

Returns:

a list of Leagues, or an uninitialized list if the response is empty.

Return type:

list

Important

Gets info from the previous year if the current month is between January and June, or the current year otherwise.

market_value(year: str | None = None)

Get the Teams’s Transfermarkt Market Value for a given year.

Parameters:

year (Optional[str]) – the year to be selected. If this parameter is not set, get the current value.

Return type:

int

market_value_over_time() → dict[int] | int

Get the Teams’s Transfermarkt Market Value over time.

Returns:

an object or 0 in case of error.

Return type:

dict[int]

name() → str

Get the name of the Team object.

Returns:

the name.

Return type:

str

opponent_statistics() → str

Get the Team object Opposition FBRef statistics for a given year.

Returns:

a Statistic object.

Return type:

Statistic

Returns:

a hash of Statistic objects.

Return type:

str

players() → list

Get the current Team object players.

Returns:

a list of players or an empty list

Return type:

list

profile() → dict | None

Return the API-Football profile of the Team object.

Variables:

fapi_profile

Returns:

the API-Foorball profile or None in case the response is empty.

Return type:

dict | None

statistic(stat) → Statistic

Get the Team object FBRef statistics for a given year and Statistic.

Parameters:

stat (str) – internal or display name of a statistic.

Returns:

a Statistic object.

Return type:

Statistic

Returns the Team object FBRef Statistics for a given year.

Returns:

a hash of Statistic objects.

Return type:

str

to_json() → dict

Get a JSON representation of the Team object.

Return type:

class soccerapi.obj.league.League(league_data, db)

The soccer League object.

Variables:

  • table (str) – the object type. This value cannot be changed and is fixed to leagues.

  • id (str) – League’s Soccer API ID.

  • country (str) – League’s country.

  • tm_id (str) – Leagues’s Transfermarkt ID.

  • fpai_id (str) – League’s API-Football ID.

  • fbref_stat_detail_level (str) – level of Statistic detail FBRef provides for this League object.

  • understat_id (str) – Leagues’s Understat ID.

  • db (PostgreSQL) – a database instance.

Create a new instance.

Parameters:

  • league_data – an object containing the League’s data as strings.

  • db (PostgreSQL) – a database instance.

export()

Export the League object as a JSON file.

Note

The output filename is in the format league_{self.id}.json.

fixture_list(year: str | None = None) → list[Fixture]

Get a list of League objects Fixtures for a given year.

Parameters:

year (Optional[str]) – the year to be selected. If this parameter is not set, get the current value.

Returns:

a list of Fixture, or an empty list in case of error.

Return type:

list[Fixture] | list

fixtures(date: str | None = None) → list[Fixture]

Get a list of League objects Fixtures for a given date.

Parameters:

date (Optional[str]) – the date to be selected. If this parameter is not set, get the current local timezone timestamp. Defaults to None.

Returns:

a list of Fixture, or an empty list in case of error.

Return type:

list[Fixture] | list

import_data(data: dict[str])

Populate Leage object data based on a League JSON file.

Parameters:

data (dict[str]) – JSON representation of the League object.

Variables:

  • fapi_profile

  • team – A list of Team objects belonging to the League object.

market_value(year: str | None = None) → int

Get the League’s Transfermarkt Market Value for a given year.

Parameters:

year (Optional[str]) – the year to be selected. If this parameter is not set, get the current value.

Return type:

int

market_value_over_time() → dict[int]

Get the League’s Transfermarkt Market Value over time.

Returns:

an object or 0 in case of error.

Return type:

dict[int]

name() → str

Get the name of the League.

Returns:

the League name.

Return type:

str

profile() → Any | None

Return the API-Football profile of the League object.

Variables:

fapi_profile

Returns:

the FAPI profile, or None in case of error.

Return type:

Any | None

teams(year: str | None = None) → list[Team]

Return the League’s object teams for a given year.

Variables:

teams_cache

Parameters:

year (Optional[str]) – desired year for the information. Defaults to None.

Returns:

the list of Team objects, or an empty list in case of error.

Return type:

List[Team]

Important

Gets info from the previous year if the current month is between January and June, or the current year otherwise.

to_json() → dict

Get a JSON representation of the Player object.

Return type:

dict

class soccerapi.obj.statistic.Statistic(stat_data: dict)

Statistics object.

Variables:

  • key (str) – internal name for a Statistic object.

  • value (float) – numeric value of the Statistic object.

  • percentile (float) – percentile representation of a Statistics value.

  • name (str) – display name for a Statistic object.

Create a new instance.

Parameters:

stat_data (dict) – The data to be populated into a Statistic object.

to_json() → dict

Get a JSON representation of the Statistic object.

Return type:

dict

class soccerapi.obj.fixture.Fixture(match_data, db)

The Fixture object.

Variables:

  • id (str) – API-Football Fixture ID.

  • fixture-details (dict) – API-Football Fixture description.

  • home_goals (int) – goals scored by the home team.

  • away_goals (int) – goals scored by the away team.

  • score_history (dict) – history of Goals scored in match.

  • league (League) – League the Fixture is from.

  • home_team (Team) – home Team in Fixture.

  • away_team (Team) – away Team in Fixture.

  • db (PostgreSQL) – a database instance.

away_starting_xi() → list[Team]

Get the away Team’s starting XI.

Returns:

a list of Team objects, or an empty list in case of errors.

Return type:

list[Team]

away_team_sheet() → list[Team]

Get the away Team’s entire team sheet.

Returns:

a list of Team objects, or an empty list in case of errors.

Return type:

list[Team]

export()

Export the Fixture object as a JSON file.

Note

The output filename is in the format ficture_{self.id}.json.

home_starting_xi() → list[Team]

Get the home Team’s starting XI.

Returns:

a list of Team objects, or an empty list in case of errors.

Return type:

list[Team]

home_team_sheet() → list[Team]

Get the home Team’s entire team sheet.

Returns:

a list of Team objects, or an empty list in case of errors.

Return type:

list[Team]

statistics(player: Player | None = None) → list

Get the API-Football statistics from a Fixture for both teams or a given player.

Parameters:

player (Optional[Player]) – Player object you want the statistics of.

Returns:

a hash of Statistic objects.

Return type:

dict

to_json() → dict

Get a JSON representation of the Fixture object.

Return type:

dict
